content.description: The Bartlett Crack, AKA Stranger Than Fiction, AKA White Slipper. A ferocious Devil. I never expected to find such a wild and engaging piece of crack climbing. Brutally steep, with awesome, sporty, crack moves.
content.protection:
in camalots

#5

6X #.75s

3X #.5s

2X #.4s

2X #.3s

Yellow X4

Thats the send rack. To get a top rope up, take more .75s .5s .4s and .3s, and probably a couple #1s
content.location: Turn off dubinky wells road, towards Bartlett. drive about 1.4, parking in some sand at the top of a long gradual hill. Hike up the dunes to the crag, and the BWC is a few minutes right. look for faint trail thru some dense crypto gardens

content.description: I may be overselling this one with a 4 star rating (some soft rock), but its a truly special pitch. A steep and insecure flare puts you under a beautiful rattly finger splitter. Widens to thin hands at the top. Niels wanted to rate it 12-, but hes a bit of a sandbagger.
content.protection: a bunch of .4s thru #1s quads or therabouts
content.location: turn onto bartlett wash rd, and drive about 1.9 miles, turning into a campsite below the prow of the buttress. Hike back into the canyon behind the buttress, aiming for the beautiful chocolate wall, split by an awesome crack.
